column4: hmm i got a strang problem: i got a disk with 0 GB free space, i remove a 18 GB dir and df -h still says there is 0 GB free, while the 18 GB dir is gone
i deleted it via the command line
did you "fresh install"? and did you manually partition?
it is a 500GB USB disk, 1 ext3 partition
what the output from sudo fdisk -l
from that device it is this: /dev/sdb1               1       60801   488384001   83  Linux
so both sda1 and sdb1 are pretty big.. which hold your /home?
/home is not a seperate mount, just a dir in /dev/sda1  , the disk that is causing the problems is /dev/sdb1 , mounted on /media/disk/
I'm going to have to defer to those more knowledgable.. at this point I'm stuck
